byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Wimberley, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Reporting was contributed by Melissa Gaskill and David Montgomery from Austin, Tex.; Patrick McGee from Midlothian, Tex.; and John Corrales from New York.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Residents of Texas areas affected by severe flooding form volunteer units to look for missing persons, bringing sense of community to region hard hit by disaster.
lead_paragraph: The death toll from an unusually severe set of storms in Texas, Oklahoma and Louisiana reached as high as 19, with more than a dozen people missing.

headline.main: Hundreds Form Search Parties to Seek Survivors in Texas Floods
headline.print_headline: Hundreds Form Search Parties to Seek Survivors in Texas Floods

snippet: The death toll from an unusually severe set of storms in Texas, Oklahoma and Louisiana reached as high as 19, with more than a dozen people missing.
